com.github.triceo.splitlog

Interface LogTailer


  • public interface LogTailer
    Tailer's primary function is to allow users to work with their portion of the tailed log file. It provides means for a blocking wait for particular chunks, and can also send these chunks to output.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      List<Message> getMessages()
      Retrieve messages that this tailer has been notified of, including tags
      List<Message> getMessages(MessageCondition condition)
      Retrieve messages that this tailer has been notified of, if a certain condition holds true for them, including tags.
      boolean isTerminated() 
      void tag(String tagLine)
      Mark the current location in the tail by a custom message.
      String waitFor(LineCondition condition)
      Will block until a line appears in the log, for which the condition is true.

      Will block until a line appears in the log, for which the condition is true.

      Will block until a message arrives, for which the condition is true.

    • Method Detail

      • getMessages

        List<Message> getMessages()
        Retrieve messages that this tailer has been notified of, including tags
        Returns:
        Messages we are aware of, in their original order.

      • getMessages

        List<Message> getMessages(MessageCondition condition)
        Retrieve messages that this tailer has been notified of, if a certain condition holds true for them, including tags.
        Parameters:
        condition - The condition.
        Returns:
        Every message we are aware of, for which the condition holds true.

      • isTerminated

        boolean isTerminated()

      • tag

        void tag(String tagLine)
        Mark the current location in the tail by a custom message. It is up to the implementors to decide whether or not a tag inserted at the same time twice is inserted twice, or the second tag overwrites the first.
        Parameters:
        tagLine - Text of the message.

      • waitFor

        String waitFor(LineCondition condition)
        Will block until a line appears in the log, for which the condition is true.
        Parameters:
        condition - Condition that needs to be true for the method to unblock.
        Returns:
        Null if the method unblocked due to some other reason.

      • waitFor

        String waitFor(LineCondition condition,
             long timeout,
             TimeUnit unit)
        Will block until a line appears in the log, for which the condition is true. If none appears before the timeout, it unblocks anyway.
        Parameters:
        condition - Condition that needs to be true for the method to unblock.
        Returns:
        Null if the method unblocked due to some other reason.

      • waitFor

        Message waitFor(MessageCondition condition)
        Will block until a message arrives, for which the condition is true.
        Parameters:
        condition - Condition that needs to be true for the method to unblock.
        Returns:
        Null if the method unblocked due to some other reason.

      • waitFor

        Message waitFor(MessageCondition condition,
              long timeout,
              TimeUnit unit)
        Will block until a message arrives, for which the condition is true. If none arrives before the timeout, it unblocks anyway.
        Parameters:
        condition - Condition that needs to be true for the method to unblock.
        Returns:
        Null if the method unblocked due to some other reason.

      • write

        boolean write(OutputStream stream)
        Will write to a stream that which is be returned by getMessages().
        Parameters:
        stream - Target.
        Returns:
        True if written, false otherwise.

      • write

        boolean write(OutputStream stream,
            MessageCondition condition)
        Will write to a stream that which is be returned by getMessages(MessageCondition).
        Parameters:
        stream - Target.
        condition - The condition to pass to getMessages(MessageCondition).
        Returns:
        True if written, false otherwise.
